statement.p: A grain silo is shown below. The silo is filled halfway full with grain.
Measurements are in feet. Round your answer appropriately given the measurements.
Determine the volume of grain in the silo.

solution.p: The volume of a cylinder is \displaystyle{V}=\pi{r}^{{2}}{h}. Here the radius is \displaystyle{r}={2.00}. The height of the silo is \displaystyle{14.0}, but it is only half full so we can use \displaystyle{h}=\frac{{14.0}}{{2}}.
